# request()

**Type Method**

Asks the user for permission for the current app to access MusicKit.

## Declaration

```swift
static func request() async -> MusicAuthorization.Status
```

## Discussion

Before using any other MusicKit API in your app, make sure the user grants your app access to their Apple Music data, You can do this either by comparing [doc://com.apple.MusicKit/documentation/MusicKit/MusicAuthorization/currentStatus] to [doc://com.apple.MusicKit/documentation/MusicKit/MusicAuthorization/Status/authorized], or by simply calling [doc://com.apple.MusicKit/documentation/MusicKit/MusicAuthorization/request()] regardless of the current authorization status value. Calling [doc://com.apple.MusicKit/documentation/MusicKit/MusicAuthorization/request()] results in presenting a standard user consent dialog to the user when necessary.

Requesting authorization to use MusicKit requires the inclusion of a short description of the app’s reason for using MusicKit. You need to add this purpose string to the app’s `Info.plist` file using the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/BundleResources/Information-Property-List/NSAppleMusicUsageDescription] key.
